metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11233 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Git before 2.13.7, 2.14.x before 2.14.4, 2.15.x before 2.15.2, 2.16.x before 2.16.4, and 2.17.x before 2.17.1, code to sanity-check pathnames on NTFS can result in reading out-of-bounds memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.1').
